# SCNBillboardConstraint

**Class**

A constraint that orients a node to always point toward the current camera.

## Declaration

```swift
class SCNBillboardConstraint
```

## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNBillboardConstraint] object automatically adjusts a node’s orientation so that its local z-axis always points toward the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNSceneRenderer/pointOfView] node currently being used to render the scene. For example, you can use a billboard constraint to efficiently render parts of a scene using two-dimensional sprite images instead of three-dimensional geometry—by mapping sprites onto planes affected by a billboard constraint, the sprites maintain their orientation with respect to the viewer. To attach constraints to an [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode] object, use its [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/constraints] property.

## Working with a Constraint’s Degrees of Freedom

- **freeAxes**: An option that specifies which degrees of freedom the constraint affects.

## Constants

- **SCNBillboardAxis**: Options for locking the orientation of nodes affected by a billboard constraint.

## Orientation Constraints

- **SCNLookAtConstraint**: A constraint that orients a node to always point toward a specified other node.
